newsitem.title: CHINA: China's Junggar Basin to produce more oil and gas.
newsitem.headline: China's Junggar Basin to produce more oil and gas.

text.p: Junggar Basin in China's northwestern region of Xinjiang is expected to produce 10 million tonnes of crude oil annually by the end of the century, the Xinhua news agency said on Thursday.
The basin produced 8.3 million tonnes of crude last year.
Its annual gas output was estimated at three billion cubic metres by 2000, Xinhua said, quoting an unidentified source. It gave no comparative figures.
The basin was expected to verify 600 million tonnes of oil reserves by 2000, the agency said.

Experts forecast the cumulative proven oil reserves in the basin would total three billion tonnes by 2005, Xinhua said. Its annual oil and gas output would exceed 15 million tonnes and three billion cubic metres respectively by then.
According to estimates by Chinese and foreign experts, the basin has geological oil and gas reserves totalling 6.9 billion tonnes and 1.24 trillion cubic metres respectively.
